name: Freedom Park
description: A memorial and leisure park in the heart of Lagos, built from the remains of a colonial prison and now a venue for cultural events.

name: Nike Art Gallery
description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa, showcasing traditional and contemporary Nigerian art and textiles.

name: Lekki Conservation Centre
description: A nature reserve with a canopy walkway, wildlife, and serene walking trails, ideal for eco-tourism and photography.

name: National Theatre
description: A cultural landmark and performance center dedicated to the promotion of Nigerian arts and theatre.

name: Tarkwa Bay Beach
description: A peaceful, sheltered beach accessible by boat, popular for swimming, surfing, and beachside relaxation.

name: Elegushi Beach
description: A vibrant private beach with music, nightlife, and a lively atmosphere, offering various water activities.

name: National Museum Lagos
description: Houses a rich collection of Nigerian historical artifacts, traditional arts, and archaeological findings.

name: Terra Kulture
address: Tiamiyu Savage Street, Victoria Island, Lagos, Nigeria
description: A cultural center featuring a theater, art gallery, bookstore, and Nigerian cuisine, promoting local creative arts.
